chunks.chunk_text: Is it impossible to be objective?I find it very, very hard and almost impossible to be objective.And John, that is the point.We are humans.And even if we think we are objective,our opinions and the way we were raised influence our opinions.It is impossible for us to be truly objective.We cannot be.And so question number two.Was the report objective or was it subjective?

chunks.chunk_text: Was the report objective or subjective?You know, I used to read a lot of CNN and now I would say sometimes I would consider CNN reports objective.But recently it seems like they've been quite subjective.They have changed their political point.You have the Fox News on the left and CNN on the right.No, no, no, I'm sorry.The other way around.CNN is now on the left and Fox is on the right.And it's become clear it's all political.I think in Taiwan also

chunks.chunk_text: because at the end of the day, I've heard that there are some news agencies that are left and some that are right.And that has happened.You would expect the media to be in the middle, fair, like the BBC.But even the BBC now is a bit more left.It has moved.It's not in the middle.And that's sad because I think at the end of the day, we need our media to be in the middle, to serve both sides of the political spectrum.
